battlecode.common

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • battlecode.common.Direction

  • public final class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an immutable representation of a direction in the battlecode world.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Direction EAST
      Direction that represents pointing east (right on screen).
      static Direction NORTH
      Direction that represents pointing north (up on screen).

      The radians at which this direction is facing based off of the unit circle; i.e.
      static Direction SOUTH
      Direction that represents pointing south (down on screen).
      static Direction WEST
      Direction that represents pointing west (left on screen).

    • Field Detail

      • NORTH

        public static final Direction NORTH
        Direction that represents pointing north (up on screen).

      • EAST

        public static final Direction EAST
        Direction that represents pointing east (right on screen).

      • SOUTH

        public static final Direction SOUTH
        Direction that represents pointing south (down on screen).

      • WEST

        public static final Direction WEST
        Direction that represents pointing west (left on screen).

      • radians

        public final float radians
        The radians at which this direction is facing based off of the unit circle; i.e. facing right would have 0.0 radians, up would have PI/2 radians, etc. Note: radians = (-Math.PI, Math.PI]

    • Constructor Detail

      • Direction

        public Direction(float radians)
        Parameters:
        radians - the radians at which you wish this direction to represent based off of the unit circle

      • Direction

        public Direction(float dx,
                 float dy)
        Creates a new Direction instance to represent the direction in which the vector created by dx and dy points. Requires dx or dy to be non-zero.
        Parameters:
        dx - the x component of the vector
        dy - the y component of the vector

      • Direction

        public Direction(MapLocation start,
                 MapLocation finish)
        Creates a new Direction instance to represent the direction in which the vector from start to finish points. Requires start and finish to not be the same location.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting point of the vector
        finish - the ending point of the vector

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        If another Direction equals this one. Realistically, you should never want to use this due to floating point rounding errors.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - Another Direction
        Returns:
        If the two Directions are equal

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Direction other,
                      float epsilon)
        If two Directions are equal to each other, with an error range epsilon radians.
        Parameters:
        other - Another Direction.
        epsilon - Amount of error (in radians) to allow in the comparison
        Returns:
        If the two Directions are equal within error

      • radiansBetween

        public float radiansBetween(Direction other)
        Computes the angle between the given direction and this direction in radians. Returned value will be in the range (-Math.PI, Math.PI]. Positive values mean 'other' is to the left, negative values mean 'other' is to the right.
        Parameters:
        other - the direction you wish to find the angle between
        Returns:
        the angle in radians between this direction and the given direction in the range of (-Math.PI, Math.PI].
        Bytecode cost:
        1

      • degreesBetween

        public float degreesBetween(Direction other)
        Computes the angle between the given direction and this direction in degrees. Returned value will be in the range (-180,180].
        Parameters:
        other - the direction you wish to find the angle between
        Returns:
        the angle in degrees between this direction and the given direction in the range of (-180,180].
        Bytecode cost:
        1
